item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "Most men lead lives of quiet desperation and go to the grave with the song still in them." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Carlos Ruiz Zafón
item.description: "Every book has a soul, the soul of the person who wrote it and the soul of those who read it and dream about it." -- Carlos Ruiz Zafón

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Nietzsche, Friedrich
item.description: "Love is a state in which a man sees things most decidedly as they are not." -- Nietzsche, Friedrich

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Carlos Ruiz Zafon
item.description: "A writer never forgets the first time he accepted a few coins or a word of praise in exchange for a story. He will never forget the sweet poison of vanity in his blood and the belief that, if he succeeds in not letting anyone discover his lack of talent, the dream of literature will provide him with a roof over his head, a hot meal at the end of the day, and what he covets the most: his name printed on a miserable piece of paper that surely will outlive him. A writer is condemned to remember that moment, because from then on he is doomed and his soul has a price." -- Carlos Ruiz Zafon

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Alfred Lord Tennyson
item.description: "The mirror crack'd from side to side "The curse has come upon me," cried The Lady of Shalott" -- Alfred Lord Tennyson

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Jo Walton
item.description: "Interlibrary loans are a wonder of the world and a glory of civilization." -- Jo Walton

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Jo Walton
item.description: "It doesn't matter. I have books, new books, and I can bear anything as long as there are books." -- Jo Walton

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Jo Walton
item.description: "I care more about the people in books than the people I see every day." -- Jo Walton

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Laini Taylor
item.description: "Stop squandering yourself, child. Wait for love." -- Laini Taylor

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Jo Walton
item.description: "Libraries really are wonderful. They're better than bookshops, even. I mean bookshops make a profit on selling you books, but libraries just sit there lending you books quietly out of the goodness of their hearts." -- Jo Walton

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Jo Walton
item.description: "And there's no sex, hardly any love stuff at all, in Middle Earth, which always made me think, yes, the world would be better off without it." -- Jo Walton

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Jo Walton
item.description: "The thing about Tolkien, about <i>The Lord of the Rings</i>, is that it's perfect. It's this whole world, this whole process of immersion, this journey. It's not, I'm pretty sure, actually true, but that makes it more amazing, that someone could make it all up. Reading it changes everything." -- Jo Walton

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Jo Walton
item.description: "One of the things I've always liked about science fiction is the way it makes you think about things, and look at things from angles you'd never have thought about before." -- Jo Walton

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Tahereh Mafi
item.description: "I spent my life folded between the pages of books. In the absence of human relationships I formed bonds with paper characters. I lived love and loss through stories threaded in history; I experienced adolescence by association. My world is one interwoven web of words, stringing limb to limb, bone to sinew, thoughts and images all together. I am a being comprised of letters, a character created by sentences, a figment of imagination formed through fiction." -- Tahereh Mafi

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Sam Kean
item.description: "Think of the most fussy science teacher you ever had. The one who docked your grade if the sixth decimal place in your answer was rounded incorrectly; who tucked in his periodic table T-shirt, corrected every student who said "weight" when he or she meant "mass", and made everyone, including himself, wear goggles even while mixing sugar water. Now try to imagine someone whom your teacher would hate for being anal-retentive. That is the kind of person who works for a bureau of standards and measurement." -- Sam Kean

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Sam Kean
item.description: "Never underestimate spite as a motivator for genius." -- Sam Kean

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Brian O'Reilly
item.description: "The power of food is only second to sex." -- Brian O'Reilly
